CatDescriptText: Mr. Harry Tucker, unemployed, 364 Junius Street, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 8, 1958, pg. A1 with question: "Which of these sources of leadership do you believe Negroes generally follow: church, labor, or politics? Why?" answer reads: "I would say labor.  The reason I have this opinion, I can't say at the present time."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Harry Tucker wearing dark striped button down collared shirt and light colored hat, standing on corner of Fifth and Liberty Avenues, Thrift Drugs store in background, Downtown
